column11: let people know what’s happening. Donate money to foundations helping with fire relief. Levantemos Chile is a great option for this. Instructions to donate from outside Chile via Swift: Financial Institution: Banco de Chile Branch: Central Address: Ahumada No. 251
column13: Chile SWIFT Code: BCHICLRM Beneficiary Account (USD): 05-000-98027-01 “We will appreciate if you can send us an email with your info and details of the money transfer for our registry.” You can also donate through PayPal on their website.  Donate to specific areas through GoFundMe’s set up by community members. Empedrado Fire Victims  Help for Chile Firemen (firemen in Chile are all volunteers and receive no pay
column14: they are the real heroes) Help for Chile’s Wildfire Victims Victims of Chilean Wildfires These fundraisers are easily found with a quick google search. More and more pop up every hour
column15: so go ahead and donate! If you have family or friends in Chile

thinksquad 162507962760 "2017-07-02 12:19:13 GMT" http://think-squad.com/post/162507962760/when-is-the-real-independence-day-july-2-or-july "If John Adams were alive today
column2: he would tell you July 2nd. Other Founders would say July 4th
column3: the day that is currently recognized as a federal holiday by our national government. And still other Founders would say
column4: “what Independence Day?” since the holiday wasn’t widely celebrated until many of the Founders had passed away.Here is the evidence
column5: so you can decide which Independence Day is really Independence Day!Officially
column6: the Continental Congress declared its freedom from Britain on July 2
column8: when it approved a resolution and delegates from New York were given permission to make it a unanimous vote.John Adams thought July 2 would be marked as a national holiday for generations to come.“The most memorable Epocha
column9: in the History of America. I am apt to believe that it will be celebrated
column11: as the great anniversary Festival… It ought to be solemnized with Pomp and Parade with shews
column16: Bonfires and Illuminations from one End of this continent to the other from this Time forward forever more
column17: ” Adams said about what he envisioned as a July 2nd national holiday.After voting on independence on July 2
column18: the Continental Congress needed to draft a document explaining the move to the public. It had been proposed in draft form by the Committee of Five (John Adams
column21: Benjamin Franklin and Thomas Jefferson) and it took two days for the Congress to agree on the edits.Once the Congress approved the actual Declaration on Independence document on July 4
column22: it ordered that it be sent to a printer named John Dunlap. About 200 copies of the Dunlap Broadside were printed
column23: with John Hancock’s name printed at the bottom. Today
column24: 26 copies remain.That is why the Declaration has the words
column29: because that is the day the approved last version was signed in Philadelphia.On July 8
column31: Colonel John Nixon of Philadelphia read a printed Declaration of Independence to the public for the first time on what is now called Independence Square.(Most of the members of the Continental Congress signed a version of the Declaration on August 2
column32: 1776 in Philadelphia. The names of the signers were released publicly in early 1777. So that famous painting showing the signing of the Declaration on July 4
column33: 1776 is a bit of an exaggeration.)The late historian Pauline Maier said in her 1997 book about the Declaration that no member of Congress recalled in early July 1777 that it was almost a year since they declared their freedom from the British. They finally remembered the event on July 3
column35: and July 4th became the day that seemed to make sense for celebrating independence.Maier also said that the Declaration (and celebrating its signing) was stuck in an early feud between the Federalists (of John Adams) and the Republicans (of Thomas Jefferson).  The Declaration and its anniversary day weren’t widely celebrated until the Federalists faded away from the political scene after 1812.In 1870
column36: Independence Day was made an unpaid holiday for federal employees. In 1941
column37: Congress made it a paid holiday for them.In the last letter he ever wrote
column38: Thomas Jefferson spoke in 1826 of the importance of the day. “For ourselves
column39: let the annual return of this day forever refresh our recollections of these rights
column40: and an undiminished devotion to them
column42: Jefferson and Adams both passed away on the Fourth of July." True link
